title: Circular Motion - Coefficient Of Static Friction

content.question: Which of the following expressions correctly represents the minimum coefficient of static friction required to prevent the coin from sliding on the disk?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator R omega squared, and denominator g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>R</mi><msup><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator omega squared, and denominator g R, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msup><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mi>R</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator R omega squared, and denominator m g, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>R</mi><msup><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="m R times omega squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>m</mi><mi>R</mi><msup><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator R omega squared, and denominator g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>R</mi><msup><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mi>g</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
